content.p: Award categories and full information about entry criteria can be found on the KE&I website under categories and criteria. If you cannot find the answer to your question below, please email keiawards@nottingham.ac.uk Entries will be accepted up until midnight Thursday 5 July 2018 (UK time). Entries received after this deadline will not be put forward for review by the judging panel. The results will be announced at a dinner at the East Midlands Conference Centre on the evening of Thursday 22 November 2018. Shortlisted entrants will be announced in September and will be invited to attend the awards dinner. Yes, you can apply for the Knowledge Exchange and Impact Award for your faculty,as well as the Vice-Chancellor’s Award for Knowledge Exchange and the Media and Policy impact awards if you wish. Yes, you can enter the Knowledge Exchange and Impact Awards even if you entered the 2014 and / or 2016 awards. However, you will need to complete the online form for this year’s awards. Applicants from UNNC and UNMC are eligible to enter all categories. There are no funds available from the UK to pay for travel to attend the awards. An entry can be submitted based on potential and/or current evidenced success. However, applicants will need to put forward a strong case to demonstrate a projects potential. Please refer to the judging criteria for further information. Jubilee Conference Centre Jubilee Campus Triumph Road Nottingham, NG8 1DH telephone: +44 (0) 115 748 4555 fax: +44 (0) 115 823 2181 email: keiawards@nottingham.ac.uk
